definition: the act or process of splitting or partitioning
details:
noun
- the act or process of splitting or partitioning
= example: the act or process of splitting or partitioning
- an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of multiplication
= example: an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of multiplication
- one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
= example: one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
= synonyms: part, section
- discord that splits a group
= example: discord that splits a group
= synonyms: variance
- an army unit large enough to sustain combat
= example: an army unit large enough to sustain combat
- a group of ships of similar type
= example: a group of ships of similar type
= synonyms: naval division
- a unit of the United States Air Force usually comprising two or more wings
= example: a unit of the United States Air Force usually comprising two or more wings
= synonyms: air division
- an administrative unit in government or business
= example: an administrative unit in government or business
- in biology, a group of organisms forming a subdivision of a larger category
= example: in biology, a group of organisms forming a subdivision of a larger category
- a league ranked by quality
= example: a league ranked by quality
= synonyms: class
